Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Sputum \Spu"tum\ (sp[=u]"t[u^]m), n.; pl. {Sputa} (-t[.a]). [L., from spuere, sputum, to spit.] That which is expectorated; a salival discharge; spittle; saliva. [1913 Webster]

sputum n : expectorated matter; saliva mixed with discharges from the respiratory passages; in ancient and medieval physiology it was believed to cause sluggishness [syn: {phlegm}] [also: {sputa} (pl)]
